Title: For a University Against Itself
Description: This zine explores the currernt rise of student protest movements at the University of Pittsburgh and how the university has chosen to respond.

Title: Why I Left the PSL…
Description: This zine describes the Party for Socialism and Liberation and other organizations like it, and the author's experience with high pressure recruitment tactics and 'fascist like organizational structures'. It was published in July of 2021

Title: Anarchism and What it Really Stands for
Description: Reprinting of an essay by Emma Goldman with commentary by the creator

Title: How To Start a Fire
Description: This zine calls for the creation of working and living co-ops in response to late stage capitalism with a focus on practical steps and skills required

Title: Substance: uncompromising life in Pittsburgh
Description: An introduction to the Greater Pittsburgh Anarchist Collective and the work that they have accomplished. It was published in spring of 2009

Title: Anarchism, Collectives, and Consensus
Description: This zine is a reaction to and commentary on an anarchafeminst manifesto. It was published in May of 2003
